repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: not sure if removing the following would have some side effects
would it be okay if we don't try to load the buffer if we are deleting it anyway? not so sure
yep, it's redundant in this case.
this doesn't need to load the buffer. it should just passively return the initial value (all that matters is that it is a monotonic counter).
I don't think neither keymap state nor variable (get/set_var) state depend on the buffer being loaded, so it can be omitted.

IMO this should not be done. "attach" expresses interests in callbacks about the buffer. It should be possible to pre-register this interest in an unloaded buffer without any change of state (and then have events start arriving once it is loaded). I think this is already how it works as well.
This should already be done by `aucmd_prepbuf()`
This is redundant with your addition and can be savely removed :)  (the `buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL` check was not needed)
I'm unsure if named marks make use of the memline (the part of the buffer which is loaded/unloaded) or not. would need to check the implementation of `set_mark()`

is it fine to remove these two specs? these were there to make sure there was no UB for unloaded buffers, but since this PR makes sure buffer related methods ensure that the buffer is loaded, these are unnecessary if I understand correctly 
(these specs were also failing, so I wondering if its even worth it to fix them)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -117,36 +117,6 @@ describe('api/buf', function()
       eq({5, 2}, meths.win_get_cursor(win2))
     end)
 
-    it('line_count has defined behaviour for unloaded buffers', function()

comment_data.body:
Tests should be kept but updated to new behavior. 

Also we need to document this as a breaking change. On master and before it is possible to use `nvim_buf_line_count` to both detect if a buffer is loaded or not (a loaded buffer never has zero lines) and how big it is if it's loaded. I don't think there are many plugins who do this anymore, but it needs to be clearly documented, so if a plugin breaks this can be found as a likely cause.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -117,36 +117,6 @@ describe('api/buf', function()
       eq({5, 2}, meths.win_get_cursor(win2))
     end)
 
-    it('line_count has defined behaviour for unloaded buffers', function()

title: fix(api): ensure buffer is loaded in most buffer related api methods
